result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:36 PM (64-06) Defendant Christina Maria Ramirez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Christina Maria Ramirez.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Defends acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy Trial is reserved.

Adj. 2:38PM
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christina Maria Ramirez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Christina Maria Ramirez.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 1:23 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for adjourned initial appearance. Record by Atty. Maynard as to review of charges and penalties. He waives further reading and asks for preliminary hearing outside time limits. Court sets as requested.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Christina Maria Ramirez in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Josh Ryan for defendant. SPD needs time to appoint. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Christina M Ramirez in court. Samuel Berg Appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman appearing in court for defendant Christina M. Ramirez. Defendant is on a PO hold. State needs some time to make a charging decision.
Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.L., D.D.T. OR W.R. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
